benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from payment

covered: Valid Deletion Scenarios: Numerous TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC20 demonstrate successful deletion of custom fields (all or specific) with 204 responses and empty bodies, including idempotent behavior when no fields remain.

Error and input handling: Tests cover invalid paymentId format (TC08), non-existent paymentId (TC09), missing required header (TC11), invalid/unauthorized token (TC12 TC, TC12), and malformed header values (TC17).

Query parameter coverage: Wide coverage of customField query parameter combinations (TC02, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC10, TC13, TC16, TC18), including extra parameters, large counts (TC06 with 100, TC15 with 1000), and mixed valid/invalid inputs (TC16, TC18).
Headers and optional fields: Tests validate optional headers (TC03), and header-based behavior like missing header or invalid header values (TC11, TC17).
Large payloads and performance: Large-field scenarios covered (TC06: 100 fields, TC15: 1000 fields) and performance check (TC19).
Integration with dependent services: Audit log integration covered (TC21, TC22) with both available and unavailable audit services.
Regression and compatibility: Backward compatibility with legacy client (TC23) and regression scenario (TC20).
Error responses and status coverage: 400/404/401/503 responses tested across multiple scenarios, including service unavailability (TC14, TC22).
Soft response semantics: 204 responses confirm empty bodies on success, aligning with DELETE expectations.
Idempotence and empty-body verification: Repeated deletions (e.g., TC04, TC01) yield 204 with empty bodies, indicating idempotent behavior.
gaps: Concurrency/race-condition scenarios are not explicitly tested (e.g., two clients deleting the same payment concurrently).
Soft-delete semantics or visibility (if applicable to fields) are not explicitly validated beyond field removal.
Rate-limiting/throttling tests for rapid successive DELETE calls are not present.
Caching behavior checks (ETag, Cache-Control headers) are not tested for this endpoint.
403 Forbidden scenarios are not explicitly tested (only 401 Unauthorized).
Pagination considerations are not applicable to DELETE of fields, but no pagination-specific coverage is provided for any related surface area.
recommendations: Add a concurrency/race-condition test to verify behavior when multiple clients attempt to remove fields simultaneously (e.g., two parallel DELETE requests).
Include a scenario validating 403 Forbidden to complement the existing 401 Unauthorized path.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure the API behaves correctly under bursty load.
Add caching headers validation (ETag, Cache-Control) if caching is meaningful for this endpoint, or document why it is not applicable.
If soft-delete semantics apply in the domain, add tests to verify and observe the soft-delete behavior/flags associated with removed fields.
Consider a focused idempotence test that repeats DELETE calls across time to explicitly confirm consistent 204 responses and no residual effects.
